column4: How do I uninstall ubuntu from a partition on my powerbook? I cannot find any documentation :(
just format it to whatever else you want
How?
Do I need the ubuntu live disc?
whatever partition tools are on OSX, or you could use a liveCD, sure.
The osx native partition tool is called disk utility, it does not recognize the ubuntu partition.
So I guess I am forced to use the ubuntu live disc, right ?
should still be able to partition it, even if it's an unknown filetype
if disk manager can't do it, then boot up a liveCD, partition it to free space, or to something that disk man. can read, like... maybe fat or something
use gksudo to start gedit
what is gksudo ?
gk?
it'll run gedit with full perms
does gedit not have permissions because the file is currentlly being used?
no, gedit normally doesn't have permissions becuase you're opening it as your user, not the super user
thanks.
sort of
aptitude is already installed
Oh. So how do I use it? 'sudo aptitude samba' ?
aptitude can be used like apt get, or in an interactive GUI
So if I want Samba, I would enter 'sudo aptitude install samba' ?
